text.0: to meet your treasurebringing car the mighty car most dear to us.
text.1: aśvins the Ṛṣi is prepared your raiser with his song of praise lovers of sweetness hear my call.
text.2: pass o ye aśvins pass away beyond all tribes of selfish men.
text.3: wonderful with your golden paths most gracious bringers of the flood lovers of sweetness hear my call.
text.4: come to us o ye aśvin pair bringing your precious treasures come.
text.5: ye rudras on your paths of gold rejoicing rich in store of wealth lovers of sweetness hear my call.
text.6: o strong and good the voice of him who lauds you well cleaves to your car.
text.7: and that great beast your chariotsteed fair wonderful makes dainty food lovers of sweetness hear my call.
text.8: watchful in spirit born on cars impetuous listing to his cry.
text.9: aśvins with winged steeds ye speed down to cyavana void of guile lovers of sweetness hear my call.
text.10: hither o heroes let your steeds of dappled hue yoked at the thought.
text.11: your flying steeds o aśvins bring you hitherward with bliss to drink lovers of sweetness hear my call.
text.12: o aśvins hither come to us nāsatyas be not disinclined.
text.13: through longing for the pious turn out of the way to reach our home lovers of sweetness bear my call.
text.14: ye lords of splendour free from guile come stand at this our sacrifice.
text.15: beside the singer aśvins who longs for your grace and lauds you both lovers of sweetness hear my call.
text.16: dawn with her white herd hath appeared and in due time hath fire been placed.
text.17: harnessed is your immortal car o wonderworkers strong and kind lovers of sweetness bear my call.
